feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a payroll feature that automatically computes daily pay deductions for employees taking unpaid leave. It calculates daily pay by dividing the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month. The calculation accounts for public holidays by deducting them from the total working days, and supports both calendar day and working day leave policies. Once an unpaid leave request is approved, the system automatically generates a pay deduction that is reflected on the payroll table. This ensures accurate salary adjustments based on the employee's leave policy and the specific month's working days.

job_to_be_done.content: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month.

Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages, including salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions, with multiple calculation bases to align with company policies and labor law requirements.
Allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations by selecting salary components and calculation methods
Calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis to be set off against the employee's monthly pay
Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement

primary_personas.content: HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations.
Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors who configure and manage daily wage calculations.
Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings configuration
Super Admins who configure leave policies and unpaid leave deduction calculations
Super admin users who manage payroll configuration and salary proration settings

navigation_paths.content: Access the Daily Wage Calculator from Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation.
Access the Daily Wage Calculator via Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure
Settings → Leaves → Leave Policies → Add policy → Unpaid leave selection

prerequisites.content: An approved unpaid leave request must exist for the employee before daily pay deduction is calculated and reflected on the payroll table.
Company's public holiday calendar must be set up to exclude weekends and public holidays when using the working days calculation base.
User must have super admin role to access and configure leave encashment settings
Access to Leave Settings as a Super Admin; ability to add or modify a leave policy
Super admin access to payroll settings; existing payroll system with employee salary data

data_inputs_required.content: Employee's total salary (Basic + Allowance), number of working days in the month, number of calendar days (if using calendar day leave policy), public holidays falling in the month, and approved unpaid leave days.

Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and choice of salary components to factor into calculations (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only).
Salary components selection (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), calculation method selection (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days), and eligible leave types for encashment configuration
Selection of calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)
Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days

outputs_results.content: Automatic pay deduction associated with the unpaid leave request, reflected on the payroll table, and calculated daily pay rate used to determine the salary reduction amount.
Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
Customized leave encashment policy configuration that affects end-of-service calculations and determines which salary components and calculation methods apply to leave encashments
Configured unpaid leave deduction calculation method for the leave policy that will be applied to monthly employee payroll
Updated salary calculations that proportionally adjust employee compensation based on selected calculation method; changes apply to all active unpaid amounts in the payroll table

procedures.content: Approve unpaid leave request, determine applicable leave policy (calendar days or working days), identify public holidays in the month, calculate actual working days by subtracting public holidays from total working days, calculate daily pay by dividing salary amount by actual working days, and generate automatic pay deduction on payroll table.

Navigate to Settings, select Payroll, choose Daily Wage Calculation, select the calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and choose which salary components to include in the calculation.

Navigate to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure; select applicable salary components for leave encashments; choose calculation method (calendar days, working days, or custom days); configure individual leave types eligible for encashment in end of service

Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select the Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. 2. Select calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). 3. Save changes. 4. If payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, reject those transactions and then save the new proration settings

rules_limitations_constraints.content: Daily pay is calculated using the formula: Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) / Number of actual working days. The leave policy determines whether calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days) are used as the base. Public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from the working days to arrive at the actual working days used in the calculation.

Calendar days calculation uses the actual number of days in a given month (e.g., 31 for January, 28 for February). Working days calculation excludes weekends and public holidays from the company's public holiday calendar. Custom days allows flexibility for company-specific policies, with most UAE and KSA companies using 30 custom days to comply with labor law.

Salary component options are limited to Basic Only or Basic + Allowances; calculation method options are Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days; configuration applies to eligible paid leave-type policies which may overwrite existing policies
Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated on a daily basis and set off against the employee's monthly pay; Super Admins have flexibility to choose from multiple calculation and day type options

Changes to salary proration affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted for one or multiple employees, Super admin must reject the transactions before saving new proration settings

edge_cases_warnings.content: Public holidays must be carefully identified and subtracted from the total working days when calculating daily pay. For example, if 2 public holidays fall in a month with a 22-day working day policy, the daily pay calculation uses 20 days instead of 22 days.

Calculation results vary depending on month length and the selected calculation base; different calculation methods can significantly impact final wage calculations for salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions.
Super admins can view which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten by the new leave encashment configuration to prevent unintended policy changes
Multiple options are available for daily rate calculation including Basic Only and Basic + Allowances, requiring careful selection based on organizational payroll policy
When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist, Super admin must manually reject and resave transactions to apply new salary proration settings

feature_interactions_dependencies.content: The daily wage calculator interacts with the payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions, and integrates with leave management systems to process approved unpaid leave requests and employee record systems to access salary information.

The Daily Wage Calculator interacts with Payroll settings, the company's public holiday calendar, and leave management systems to determine accurate daily wage rates for salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction.
Interacts with Payroll settings, End of Service calculations, and Leave Management system to customize leave encashment policies that affect end-of-service payroll processing
Interacts with the payroll system to apply daily unpaid leave deductions to monthly employee pay; similar to leave encashment functionality
Interacts with the Payroll system and affects active payroll table transactions; impacts employee first salary and end-of-service settlement calculations

glossary_terms.content: Daily pay: The calculated daily salary rate used to determine deductions for unpaid leave, computed by dividing total salary by actual working days. Actual working days: The number of working days in a month after deducting public holidays. Calendar days: A leave policy based on total calendar days in a month (e.g., 30 days). Working days: A leave policy based on business working days excluding weekends (e.g., 22 days). Public holidays: Days designated as holidays that are excluded from working day calculations.

Calendar days: the number of days in a given month. Working days: only business days counted, excluding weekends and public holidays. Custom days: flexible calculation base set according to company policies.

Leave encashment: The process of converting unused leave into monetary compensation; End-of-service: Final payroll settlement when an employee leaves the organization; Daily Wage Calculator: Configuration tool for customizing leave encashment calculations

Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee without compensation; Daily rate calculation: Method of computing deductions based on daily wage amounts; Leave encashment: Similar feature for calculating leave payouts

Daily Wage Calculator (DWC): System component for configuring salary proration. Salary Proration: Proportional adjustment of employee salary based on actual days worked. Calculation bases: custom days (user-defined), calendar days (all days in period), working days (business days only)
